message.body: Thanks for testing Pandam. Btw, try the arrow keys. :D
Six out of the top 10 torrent sites are down.﻿
The odd thing is that no-one in 6 months tried the arrow keys (at least judging from top scores) haha
Yes. You're the first person to post more than one word. Congrats! :) I made a move. says network error. reconnecting.
The chess doesn't connect for me.
ok, it working. (0ws..)
the chat disappeared, but theres a player for the game
forward, backward etc
Hey thanks. it was a good game.
Good hunting there tkarita!
Haven't a clue what ZeroMe (merger sites) looks like.. so keen to see it.
And if it's better than ZeroTalk that will solve our problems.
One problem i have with all these site is not being able to right-click save. (we get the wrapper code only)
Just something off github (placeholder for the url)
Ah. saving this chat did work. cool
Yeah, i've been running vanitygen and building a collection of url-words that i might use.
My plan was to try to make a kind of marketplace where swap sites, but i haven't worked out a way to exchange them in a way that the private keys are not abused.
Yeah, that could have taken a month or longer on my laptop but i hit it on the first morning. Just luck.
What i do is leave off the last letter and try for lower or upper case or similar, but i hit the capital Y was perfect.
Yeah, the only other way is to have strongly encrypted sites which need another key, which we can change.
I spent some time years ago thinking about how to secure JS. (google etc do a pretty good job with heavy compression, and wrapping the code to different services)
I mean, we don't see clones of G+ around the net.
Yeah, run it 5 and you'll find the odd word that takes 99%, then the % disappears. Each 50% remaining is half slower than the previous.
So with 1NFiNiT.. my laptop said weeks to 50%. That's where you don't know if it might take months if the % gets high.
Over P it's much slower. There's a chart on wikipedia which explains the cut off points.
I think it's PQ.. and over.
My other app is Sqeek.. and Sqeek is short.. so i run it until i get easily visible patterns.. 1SQEEKkYzZ
The KkYzZ is just random.. but it would take someone years to get close to faking it.
Or special hardware. ;O)
Likewise if you get a random short word in the middle or at the other end.
I found a little exe which lets me play wavs so i run "Vanitygen64 1SoMEURL & play done.wav" (play is the exe) so i hear when it's finished.
So an ideal scenario would be to have P2P miners hunting certain Vanity URLS on request list, and if you find one you win that block. (like crypto-currency)
But then we have the same problem about private keys.
Found it.. http://www.elifulkerson.com/projects/commandline-wav-player.php ..i rename it play.com
Then you can chain.. VG 1URL & play done.wav & VG 1URL & play done.wav... or just press the up arrow in console hit enter, up arrow, enter...etc.
leave the last letter off.. and let it find about 10 results. (20% chance, or better if the case is not important)
Difficulty of finding a vanity.. (near bottom) https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Vanitygen
Yep.. main "pivot" is 1QL.. so stay under that. I went upper case w/ no 1 or O so that cuts the number of interesting words.
If your word starts with 1 (I) it's a free letter.
I think it's purely random.. so we never reach 100% probability.
The estimate given is low. 95% you'll be 6x or 8x that value. 99% maybe 10x.
And i've seen 5 letters go to 20x the estimate.. which is scary if you're after 7 letters (est 1 month) lol
you need GPU? Nvidia?
lol. but with 3700 people..
1QL is 'pivot' you'll find 1QAD.. 60 times faster
@tkarita so 30 tries for A or a on the end.. 3m x 15 tries = 50% (45mins)
Ah gotcha. That T is painful. With uppercase words, they're more readable followed lowercase.. it needs some luck.
what's the hash rate?
20x faster than my cpu :)
Yeh, haven't seen nullpo since. (nice quad!)
You were gonna leave the T off. :P What's T stand for?
Nofish is answering questions on github, so i'm gonna be up all night.
nope. some guy with errors.
any guesses? http://mattiasa.blogspot.com/2016/08/please-read-this-note.html
8 x 3 = 24 .. so not a Snowden-tweet-key. lol
i broke it? *bumps*
hey all! been putting a chess zite together.. (single player vs PC so far) :P
yes, but i'll get the chat working first.
it's loading, just not sending.

like!

aye!

otherwise it thru some error. But the inner-path might still be broken. No one has logged in to chat or save a list.. that's why i'm using the same code for chess.
Of cors chat and lists works fine here w/o errors, so that must correct.
not sure about whitelisting. do u have an example?

ignore is only for automatic signing. can't you inner-path sign it manually? ie. not just json files.
running 4.0 - no issues.

Not sure why nofish puts in recurrsive functions without any checks. It's asking for trouble.
fileDone and fileFailed both call themselves with virtual-paths. Hence the issues with dual hubs.
/hub1/calls/hub2/calls/hub1.... (infinity)

It's compressed version of json, it's fast for search and retrieval (faster than json on large data), and it's a kind of backup (duplication)

you can use up/down arrow keys if the Load dropdown is in 'focus'.
i made just left/right pasting button. It was my second app and no one saved anything so i moved on without improving it.
the new scripts are clones of the load-able ones.
it was meant to allow sharing code.

i commented on Kaffie's post.. " I've fiqured out what one issue is. When i posted on your hub the post's json-id is set to "1" (first post) ..but when i return to my hub i find any post with the same id is overwriting automatically. It's a conflict of the json-ids. If could switch to unique identifier (not the post id, but wholly unique) then that would allow safe cross-hub posting."
So basically a new field in the DB for unique identifiers which are unique across hubs.
i'm sure nofish realises this too.
So sometimes we comment and shows up on two different posts. Similar issue with the duplicated profiles.
resused.. hmm, Db cleanup could do that in some circumstances.
I'll go make a page to "lookup who's following [user-name here] or [user-id here]".
@kaffie@zid: Good points!
Yep, cos i see duplicates of posts there, and it was faster to find at the bottom of your stream. =)
I just did a rebuild and activity content disappeared (first time) and my.db got slightly smaller. Just grabbed ZeroMe's and restarted 0net, everything back. It's a fast way to sync again. :P
One rebuild no problems, second time happened again. There must be bad data in there somewhere..

Right now the two databases are growing and synced. I've been rebuilding the db lots since it's in the sidebar and instantly gratifying. It's all learning curve so just sharing what's going on for others to learn from.

nofish's inbox must be a flood of quota requests. >_<
For some reason ZeroMail's send button didn't work (several browsers) so i just won't post on 0talk. ZeroMe (or here) is much better. Btw, who's admin of zeromedia?
It makes more sense to use ZeroMe with activity list, mentions, etc. Oh 500.. :P ..but ZeroMe needs "communities" (topics) type indexing.
At the moment "topics" is certain people's profiles.

Talnicrom edited his db to add mentions, but he's not a hub. I've added images field to mine, but haven't published. It shouldn't break anything, but it's inevitable people will adapt the db, even on hubs. nofish said he's gonna block merger sites from being hubs.. so yeah.

it's getting confusing. The idea you publish on one hub and people on other hubs see it, now nofish says that's not the case. Talnicrom asked about layers (hierachy) of hubs, and nofish said doesn't need. So which is it?
Either they are all connected, or bridge hubs are needed.
And those bridge hubs need rules on which hubs to connect.
But Talnicrom's mentions keeps itself updated (read-only), so it doesn't need to merge. It's a small step to take content from a large db and section it for specific hubs.
The main trick is keeping unique IDs everything, and hashes are perfect for that.
Just the URIs get quite long.
do we "update 0.4.0" to get the new rev?

@quadrangle@zid: thnx

Yeah he said was about to do that. Hmm
The problem with this is that Infinity (zerome clone) is hard to promote. Even Kaffie links to ZeroMe. I guess i can link to InfinityMe but.. ugh.

The errors are gone, and the main issue is bandwidth. (reason to separate) If there's other issues they are not major. It seems overly strict to revoke permissions cos it's "less efficient" for seeders.
Let seeders decide.

The reason to "not" separate is cos i can add sql lookups not using zeroframe API (coffeescript or it's js equivalent) and lots of other things. At the moment i can load the db from the hub into InfinityMe, but how long before that permission is revoked. (ie. cross-zite loading)
aye! i was hoping i won't need to fork ZeroNet, but that might be my only solution if i want to stay merged.
Then i have to "promote" it on github.. oh geez. just to save seeders (who have choice) some bandwidth. :(
he's a super chill guy in all respects, but his view about hubs are they have "names" and that's all. Only sex hubs will win that race.
When PornHub takes over maybe he'll see the folly of it.
@kaffie@zid: :)
I put a note on my hub. Just had 3 people join. Blocking me was perhaps good marketing, even thou it sucks.
I mean, most people on ZeroNet are against tyranny and this was done without any discussion whatsoever.
When i or Talnicrom start to discuss this nofish said it's a non-issue.
Blocked in less than a week. No porn, no drugs, no nothing. Just a nice design, and a few new feature being added. :P
The glitch is gone. We proved that.

Why run a hub?
It's a database. It's not rocket science to switch it.
So it's overkill to force the separation.
In fact nothing stops us grabbing all the profiles from other hubs and including them our own hub, am i right?

I have my reasons, and i explained some.. If i have the hub and viewer in the same zite then i can access the database with sql directly and bypass ZeroFrame. It's not about whether it's written in coffeescript or javascript, it's about making a simple zite admin an manager and editor which anyone can use. The lack of a marketplace or multiplayer games on ZeroNet gives some indication that devs are struggling with the basics. nofish is the exception here. he's rocking it!

For example PHP has PHPMyAdmin. An onsite viewer/editor for the database. Admin control panels do a similar thing with hosting. Centralised sites do it with editing content. So why is it not okay with P2P?

If the zites are clonable, and the P2P network stable (lots of users) then monopoly is not a factor. As i said on ZeroTalk (Ethics) it's all about reputation. Do we like Zuckerberg? Are we happy he has 100 Billion, and can change FB tomorrow, and we can't clone it. That's the old model we're comparing with.

Musickiller is on the wrong hub ;)

Your/19s experiment with public-private keys is interesting. I'd like to make a vanity request zite, but reputation alone won't stop someone saving the keys for later. There's a new project on github that can parallelize GPU for Javascript but really need multi-sig or something..

We really need zite key to be combined.. (bitcoin private key + user id) ..to generate, so u type in someone's user-id and the vanity request, and it doesn't generate bitcoin private keys, just the combined key.
When it finds the combined key you have to hand it over cos it's useless without the person's private user-id key
So the private user-id key would un-combine them.

With bitcoin mining we're hunting zeros. What if winning block "has to" also match part of the random user-id to win? Say '1MyVanity' and the rest can be compared to the user-id (KdnTJV.. or random matching the entire hash with user-id)
If a certain number of chars match, you win the block, but it's uniquely tied to the real owner by it's convergence with that person's user-id
Pretending it's yours wouldn't work.
@kaffie@zid: You can check balances without private keys or wallet. it's all public.

Perhaps in this scenario we'd have a 'verification' file on the zite, which has been signed by private user-id and tied to that address confirmng the user (of the id) has the private key, and perhaps timestamped for recentness.
If someone else "steals" the zite, they wouldn't be able to update the verification file, and the zite address wouldn't match their own user-id, so it would be clear it's stolen
Have a chrome app that informs the security rating (user id to zite address match) divided by however many months since the verification file was updated.
Maybe the verification file can also link us to one donate address from all of that dev's zites.
That's pretty much it. If we remove incentive to squat on another person's zite address (for donations or whatever) then less chance private keys will be hoarded/phished/etc

This was a problem with Flappy Bird ported to Zeronet. People just inserted their highscores into the DB.
I remade it with a few more tables and put in a timer and record the time to die, which gives some indication they played.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PANDAML8mLaRKPinGihTj5RkJV15awcjs/

They could of course still try to insert a highscore with a rough time which fits the game score, so i juggled things around mixing the variable names. It's pretty confusing now. And so far (6 months) no one has hacked it, thou i don't know how many have tried.
